input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command.
The name of a service or process. (Either the name or the pid is required) Note: In Windows this must be the image name of the process to be terminated.
The pid of the process to be terminated. (Either the name or the pid is required)

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation succeed? Valid values: true

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">kill -9</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${name}')!=0 and string-length('${pid}')=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> $[name]</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${pid}')!=0 and string-length('${name}')=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> $[pid]</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">kill -9</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${name}')!=0 and string-length('${pid}')=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> $[name]</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${pid}')!=0 and string-length('${name}')=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> $[pid]</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">taskkill</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${name}')!=0 and string-length('${pid}')=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /im $[name] </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${pid}')!=0 and string-length('${name}')=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /pid $[pid]</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /f</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Perform Kill Process Kills a service or process.
